title: Expose at::Tensor in python
body_html:
Now that Variable and torch.Tensor is merged, how do I create an at::Tensor from python and how do I reach the underlying at::Tensor of a Variable from python and from c++?
I have used torch and aten in c++ and python alot as an alternative to numpy, where I didnt care about the autograd part. Now I can only use autograd.Variable from python, which makes me pretty sad.

body:
Now that Variable and torch.Tensor is merged, how do I create an at::Tensor from python and how do I reach the underlying at::Tensor of a Variable from python and from c++?
I have used torch and aten in c++ and python alot as an alternative to numpy, where I didnt care about the autograd part. Now I can only use autograd.Variable from python, which makes me pretty sad.
